data.title: Best band for side projects/spin off bands?
data.meta_description: Which bands do you think provided the best? These could be solo albums from members but mainly interested in actual bands that came from them, whether...
data.text:
Which bands do you think provided the best? These could be solo albums from members but mainly interested in actual bands that came from them, whether they be side projects or spin off bands after the original band finished.

Here's an example:

The Byrds: Flying Burrito Brothers, CSN(Y), Dillard and Clark, Desert Rose Band, plus loads of great solo albums from McGuinn, Clark, Crosby, Parsons and others.

Fun Topic! Here's a few.....

Jefferson Airplane: Hot Tuna, Jefferson Starship.

Grateful Dead: Dead & Co., The Other Ones, Phil & Friends, Rat Dog, Old and in the Way.

Talking Heads: Tom Tom Club.

Allman Brothers: Gov't Mule, Great Southern.

Yes: actually lead to two simultaneous touring versions of Yes for a while.

Green River gave birth to both Mudhoney and Pearl Jam, and Pearl Jam itself has some great spinoffs such as Brad, Temple of the Dog and Mad Season.

Also: Kingfish, Jerry Garcia Band, New Riders of the Purple Sage, Legion of Mary, Bobby & the Midnights, Reconstruction, Garcia & Saunders, Mickey & the Hartbeats, Diga Rhythm Band, Keith and Donna Band, etc

Henry Cow.

Fred Frith was in Art Bears, Massacre, Skeleton Crew...

Tim Hodgkinson was in The Work, Momes, God...

John Greaves was in The Lodge.

Chris Cutler was in Art Bears, Cassiber... and together with Dagmar Krause and Lindsay Cooper in News From Babel.

All excellent albums.

Brilliant and unorthodox!

Even with that very comprehensive list I believe you're still missing a few.

……and Missing Man Formation

(everyone hates Vince)

I thought The Knitters were a very nice spinoff from X. Also Porno For Pyros from Jane's Addiction, especially the 'Good Gods Urge' album. It's funny OP, the Burrito Brothers were the first band that came to mind for me too.

I'd argue for the Grateful Dead the best one they had was Jerry Garcia Band (personally, I prefer them to the Dead).

(Some key names in this extended interrelated spin-off of a spin-off mess, in bold)

The Homosexuals ->

Ici La Ba

Sir Alick and The Phraser

L Voag

George Harrassment

L Voag ->

Amos

Amos & Sara

Amos & Co.

Amos & Superslicks

Nancy Sesay and The Melodaires

The Just Measurers

The Tesco Bombers

The Aaron Tenecil Singers

Comrad’ Oleau

Vicki Durango

Narki Brillans

Ron Dealo

Vic Surf & The Villians

The Fear Merchants

Napalm Timesavers

Klak Klak Moguls

Lepke B. ->

Gus Coma

Milk From Cheltenham

Leonard Aspen & Roger Boulding

Modern ****

Die Trip Computer Die

Xentos ‘Fray’ Bentos ->

1000 Cars Before Zero

Pu Pao In Chinese Clothing

Perfect Vacuum

2 Square Y?

Unhappy Fly

Front Line Assembly spawned several successful offshoots. Probably all plugged-into the same electrical outlets of the same studio at different times.

Leigh Nash and Zoe Johnston have flitted around like bees, pollinating that garden a little further out as well.

Zappa/The Mothers Of Invention:

Little Feat (Lowell George, Roy Estrada)

Captain Beefheart And The Magic Band (not exactly a spinoff, but several Mothers played with Beefheart after leaving the band, plus Frank producing Trout).

Geronimo Black (Jimmy Carl Black, Bunk and Buzz Gardner, Denny Walley)

Ruben & The Jets (Motorhead Sherwood, plus Frank produced the first album as well)

Flo & Eddie

George Duke

Jean-Luc Ponty

Missing Persons (Terry Bozzio, Patrick O’Hearn, Warren Cuccurullo)

Steve Vai

The Fowler Brothers

Mike Keneally

The Grandmothers of Invention

Project Object

Banned From Utopia

Adrian Belew (and all of his bands/collaborations by extent)

Patrick O’Hearn

Wild Man Fischer

And that’s just off the top of my head.

Nirvana has branches going for Krist Novocelic including Sweet 75, Eyes adrift, Giants in the Trees and Third Secret. Grohl could be a whole tree in himself, with the Foo Fighters, Them Crooked Vultures, Probot. The Foo Fighter branch then extends to Taylor Hawkins with Chevy Metal, Taylor Hawkins and the Coattail Riders, and The Birds of Satan. Chris Shiflett of the Foo Fighters has a solo career, and Chris Shiflett and the Dead Peasants.
